page.title: 06THEALE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Mrs Alice Cooke, who is 100 years old, visited our school. She talked to us in classroom which she used in 1892. She remembered Queen Victoria visiting Theale. One of her duties was to fetch water for drinking and washing from the village pump. She said the Headmaster, Mr Rudd, was very strict. He used to come straight from his kitchen through a side door into the classroom. He carried a stick and caned the people who were naughty. He also used a strap. People who were good at music practised in his house. Mrs Cooke said that she had learned to read at school and that she did a lot of sewing. She was taught many songs and heard stories from the Bible. Sometimes the Bishop visited the school.
